Posts.Content: May 24, 2010 08:17AM nekk1977 wrote: I am 32 and have 1 lump which has been biopsied twice. It had changed in 2 years so my surgeon wanted to be sure. She also put a clip in it (kind of like a homing device :) They told me many things can cantribute, weight fluctuations, hormones, stress, etc.I'm most likely going to have it removed in September for peace of mind. Â We don't always know whats going on inside our bodies but you have to be alert and proactive, and it sounds like you are, keep with the routine of checking that you are on and all will be well. Best of luck

Posts.Title: Biopsy today Kati218 Georgia1

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2018 05:39PM nekk1977 wrote: Hiiii!! I am also 40 and just had my first. What a stresser.. Almost the same as you. Had it Friday- called back Monday, back in Tuesday, met with the radiologist and she wanted me back in 6 months as well for what she said was a dilated duct.. she told me the chances were less than 1% that it was anything but I asked for the biopsy.. had that Wednesday. (This is my second- I had a fibrodenoma removed in 2009) it’s not bad at all and will be worth the peace of mind. I actually got my results today and it was not a dilated duct, it was another fibro- (benign) but back again in 6 months anyway. I’m very lumpy so I asked to listed as high risk so no more waiting in the future. You’ll do great! It’s quick and like I said the peace of mind will be awesome! Goooooood luck ðŸ˜˜

My thoughts are that I don't want to have this lump and miss something else that (god willing doesn't happen) show up and I mistake it for my old trusty lump. So Lumpectomy here I come. A little nervous about the surgery, can someone tell me what to expect? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Being a big girl nekk1977 nekk1977

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2011 10:28PM nekk1977 wrote: Hi there! Â I am sitting on my couch typing right now with my sutures and funny bra from my excision this morning. So far it has been super easy. I have a fibroadenoma that was core biopsied twice because it grew. Both times results were benign but I asked to have it removed for my own peace of mind. I would recommend this to anyone. Though the lump I had was not cancer, I did not want to risk missing something due to thinking it was the same ole lump. I went in this morning, they asked me questions about my health, got my IV going, gave me some sedatives and I woke up feeling great! I of course am a little sore but not bad at all and Im back to work Thursday morning. Even if they say you dont need it out. Just take it out, better all around. Feel free to email me if you have any questions and Good luck!!

Posts.Title: More nervous by the day nekk1977 nekk1977

Posts.Content: May 19, 2010 10:21PM nekk1977 wrote: My surgeon was amazing!! I went in 2 years ago after my primary found a lump, they sent me for an ultrasound and nothing showed up. Surgeon gave me 3 options. Leave and come back in 6 months and check again, mammogram (which she said may also show nothing) or biopsy (a lastÂ option as she felt things were normal) Me being the nervous person I am, asked for the biopsy which was done that day. Results, benign!!!! Just had another one as the lump this time showed up on the ultrasound and again, thank God, the results were normal, but I truely appreciate my surgeon who gave ME the option to decide what I wanted to do. I sleep much easier now. I reccomend that if you feel uneasy, find someone to check, chances are it's fine but you'll sleep better and stop worrying. All my best to youÂ
